intro: Thlaspi bursa-pastoris var. gracile, commonly known as rock白菜 or slender pennycress, is a flowering plant in the Brassicaceae family. It is a low-growing annual or biennial species characterized by its small, alternate leaves and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically thrives in disturbed soils and rocky habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its capsule fruits contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution. This variety is often found in temperate regions and is noted for its ecological importance in soil stabilization and as a food source for certain insects.
